population_specificity: Patients with mild UC or UC in remission, median age 34 years, including both initial episode and relapse cases.
effective_dosage: Not specified (dietary guidance provided during hospitalization).
study_duration: Two-week hospitalization with follow-up for a median of 3 years 6 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a defined, plant-based diet implemented for 4 weeks could mitigate cardiovascular disease (CVD) risk factors and reduce patient drug burden in an outpatient clinical setting.
results_summary: The study found significant reductions in systolic and diastolic blood pressure, serum lipids, total medication usage, weight, waist circumference, heart rate, insulin, glycated hemoglobin, and high-sensitivity C-reactive protein, indicating the diet effectively mitigated multiple CVD risk factors.
population_specificity: Outpatients with cardiovascular risk factors (specific demographics not detailed).
effective_dosage: Not specified (diet consisted of raw fruits, vegetables, seeds, and avocado; all animal products excluded).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a whole-food plant-based (WFPB) diet could improve and control serum lipid levels in a patient with retinoid-induced hyperlipidemia.
results_summary: The study found that adopting a WFPB diet led to a dramatic drop in serum lipid levels and improved exercise capacity, while discontinuing the diet resulted in the return of hyperlipidemia. Re-adopting the diet again sharply reduced lipid levels, demonstrating its effectiveness in managing retinoid-induced hyperlipidemia.
population_specificity: A 35-year-old man with congenital lamellar ichthyosis and retinoid-induced hyperlipidemia due to a homozygous deleterious mutation in NIPAL4.
effective_dosage: Not specified (dietary intervention, no dosage mentioned).
study_duration: Initial intervention duration not specified; follow-up over five months and later a year and a half.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of plant-based diets in preventing and managing type 2 diabetes, including their impact on diabetes-related complications.
results_summary: The study found strong evidence supporting plant-based diets for reducing the risk of type 2 diabetes and improving its management, with benefits including reduced macrovascular and microvascular complications. The type and source of macronutrients (carbohydrates, fats, proteins) were highlighted as key factors.
population_specificity: Older adults and individuals at risk of or diagnosed with type 2 diabetes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the remission rate of infliximab combined with a plant-based diet as first-line therapy for Crohn disease (CD).
results_summary: The study found high remission rates (96% intention-to-treat, 100% per-protocol), significant reductions in CDAI scores and CRP levels, and mucosal healing in 46% of cases. The combination therapy was effective in inducing remission in most patients.
population_specificity: Adults and children with newly diagnosed or relapsing CD who were naïve to biologics.
effective_dosage: Infliximab (5 mg/kg at 0, 2, and 6 weeks) plus a lacto-ovo-semivegetarian diet.

study_goal: To determine the impact of a high-fiber, low-fat, mostly plant-based diet with support on self-management of type 2 diabetes in Latinos from medically underserved areas.
results_summary: The experimental group showed a statistically significant reduction in mean A1C levels compared to the control group, indicating improved glycemic control. Both groups saw decreases in A1C, but the experimental group's reduction was more pronounced.
population_specificity: Latinos with A1C > 6.4 from medically underserved areas in San Bernardino County, California.
study_duration: 5-week education program with follow-up support at 1, 3, and 6 months post-education.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review evidence on the effects of plant-based dietary patterns on obesity and weight loss, including observational and intervention trials.
results_summary: Both clinical trials and observational research indicate that plant-based diets are effective for preventing overweight and obesity and promoting weight loss, with higher diet quality and similar adherence compared to other therapeutic diets. Future studies should focus on diverse populations and utilize health behavior theory for intervention development.
population_specificity: General population, with a noted need for future studies in older adults and more diverse groups.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize current literature on plant-based diets (PBDs) regarding their association with type 2 diabetes prevalence, clinical applications, acceptability, and community implementation.
results_summary: PBDs were associated with lower prevalence of type 2 diabetes, improved body weight, cardiovascular risk factors, insulin sensitivity, and glycemic control, and reduced need for diabetes medications, with comparable acceptability to other diabetes diets.
population_specificity: Persons with type 2 diabetes in Canada.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effectiveness of a whole food plant-based (WFPB) diet in reducing BMI and cholesterol in individuals with obesity or overweight and related metabolic conditions.
results_summary: The WFPB diet led to significant BMI reduction (4.4 kg/m² at 6 months, 4.2 kg/m² at 12 months) and modest cholesterol reduction (0.71 mmol/l at 6 months, 0.55 mmol/l at 12 months) compared to normal care, with no serious harms reported.
population_specificity: Adults aged 35-70 with obesity or overweight and at least one of type 2 diabetes, ischemic heart disease, hypertension, or hypercholesterolemia, from a general practice in Gisborne, New Zealand.
effective_dosage: Non-energy-restricted WFPB diet with vitamin B12 supplementation; no specific dosage mentioned.
study_duration: 12 weeks of facilitated meetings, with follow-up at 6 and 12 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of dietary butyrate supplementation on epigenetics, mucosal protection, and immune homeostasis in European sea bass.
results_summary: Dietary butyrate increased histone H4 acetylation but had no effect on growth rates. It altered the expression of genes related to inflammation and epigenetic regulation, with tissue-specific effects observed.
population_specificity: European sea bass (Dicentrarchus labrax)

study_goal: To evaluate the adherence, safety, and effects of a very-low-fat, plant-based diet on brain MRI, clinical outcomes, metabolic biomarkers, quality of life, and fatigue in relapsing-remitting MS patients.
results_summary: The plant-based diet showed no significant improvement in brain MRI, relapse rate, or disability but led to significant improvements in fatigue, BMI, and metabolic biomarkers like cholesterol and insulin. The diet was well-adhered to and tolerated.
population_specificity: Relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis (RRMS) patients.
effective_dosage: Total fat intake averaged ~15% of total calories.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the potential adverse effects of a low-carbohydrate diet (Atkins) and the therapeutic effects of a plant-based/semivegetarian diet on ulcerative colitis.
results_summary: The study found that a low-carbohydrate diet may trigger ulcerative colitis, while a plant-based/semivegetarian diet led to remission of symptoms without medication.
population_specificity: A 36-year-old man (172 cm, 72 kg) with ulcerative colitis.

study_goal: To evaluate the effectiveness of a whole-foods, plant-based diet (WFPB) in reducing symptoms of osteoarthritis.
results_summary: The WFPB diet significantly improved self-assessed measures of functional status, including energy/vitality, physical functioning, and pain reduction, compared to the control group. Differences in Patient Global Impression of Change and Visual Analog Scale pain assessments were statistically significant from week 2 onward.
population_specificity: Patients aged 19-70 with osteoarthritis.
effective_dosage: Not specified (whole-foods, plant-based diet as intervention).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of a whole-food plant-based diet on symptoms, weight, blood pressure, and cholesterol levels in a patient with angina and atherosclerosis.
results_summary: The patient experienced rapid improvement in angina symptoms, weight, blood pressure, and cholesterol levels after adopting a plant-based diet. The abstract also notes broader associations between plant-based diets and improved plasma lipids, diabetes control, coronary artery disease, and reduced mortality.
population_specificity: A 60-year-old man with typical angina and a positive stress test.
effective_dosage: Not specified (diet consisted primarily of vegetables, fruits, whole grains, potatoes, beans, legumes, and nuts).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy, acceptability, and nutritional adequacy of a plant-based diet as an intervention for type 2 diabetes management.
results_summary: The study found that a low-fat, plant-based diet improves glycemic control, reduces body weight, and is well-accepted by patients. It also suggests that such dietary changes can reduce cardiac risk and improve diabetes management.
population_specificity: People with type 2 diabetes.
interactions: Medication adjustment and risk of hypoglycemia were reviewed, but no specific interactions were mentioned.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how a plant-based dietary intervention, which discourages dairy and meat consumption, affects bone-relevant nutrients and biomarkers.
results_summary: The intervention increased intake of fruits, vegetables, and grains but decreased calcium and vitamin D consumption, with evidence of elevated bone resorption markers (PTH and NTx).
population_specificity: Participants in the Coronary Health Improvement Project (specific demographics not detailed in the abstract).
study_duration: 4-week educational course, with follow-ups at 6 weeks and 6 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare baseline characteristics (demographics, dietary intake, eating behaviors, and physical activity) of participants enrolling in two different weight loss studies—one using a standard reduced-calorie approach and the other using plant-based dietary approaches.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in baseline demographics, eating behaviors, or most dietary variables between participants in the plant-based and reduced-calorie weight loss studies, except for higher vitamin C intake in the standard group and higher intentional physical activity in the plant-based group.
population_specificity: Adults enrolling in two 6-month behavioral weight loss studies (mPOD and New DIETs), with New DIETs participants being older and having a higher BMI.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of an all-plant-based diet on growth performance, anti-stress properties, and related gene expression in blunt snout breams.
results_summary: The all-plant-based diet improved growth performance (higher weight gain, specific growth rate, and protein efficiency ratio) but decreased anti-stress properties (non-specific immunity, stress resistance, and antioxidant ability) and altered gene expression (HSC70 mRNA increased, HSP70 mRNA decreased).
population_specificity: Fingerling blunt snout breams (Megalobrama amblycephala)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the cost implications of adopting a plant-based diet among breast cancer survivors.
results_summary: The intervention group significantly increased vegetable-fruit intake (6.3 to 8.9 servings/day), fiber (21.6 to 29.8 g/day), and reduced fat intake (28.2% to 22.3% of energy), with a minimal cost increase of $1.22/person/week.
population_specificity: Breast cancer survivors (n=1109 intervention, n=1145 comparison).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether adopting a plant-based diet could influence the rate of PSA rise in patients with recurrent prostate cancer.
results_summary: The study found that increased intake of plant-based foods was associated with a decreased rate of PSA rise, suggesting potential therapeutic benefits for managing prostate cancer recurrence. However, the effect was not sustained at 6 months, indicating variability in long-term adherence or efficacy.
population_specificity: Asymptomatic, hormonally untreated prostate cancer patients with rising PSA levels post-surgery or radiation therapy.
effective_dosage: Not specified (servings per day of whole grains and vegetables increased, but exact dietary plan not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate vitamin B12 status and intake among Seventh-day Adventists following a plant-based diet compared to omnivore controls to assess susceptibility to vitamin B12 deficiency.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found no significant differences in serum vitamin B12 levels between plant-based Adventists and omnivore controls, attributing this to widespread consumption of fortified foods and supplements. The study highlights the importance of supplementation and fortified foods for maintaining adequate B12 status in plant-based diets.
population_specificity: Seventh-day Adventists following vegan or vegetarian diets compared to omnivore controls (some of whom were Adventists).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the health impacts of plant-based diets, focusing on benefits like reduced disease risk and potential drawbacks such as micronutrient deficiencies.
results_summary: A well-planned plant-based diet lowers the risk of cardiovascular disease, type 2 diabetes, and certain cancers, while a poorly planned one increases the risk of micronutrient deficiencies, particularly vitamin B.
population_specificity: Not specified (general population implied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the relationship between the rise in veganism and vitamin B12 deficiency, focusing on interventions through food supplementation.
results_summary: The study reviewed 70 articles, categorizing them into groups associating vitamin B12 deficiency with diseases, but specific outcomes regarding plant-based diet efficacy were not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Different demographics, not further specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether the gut microbiome and metabolome could explain the variability in responses to n-3 PUFA supplementation and how a plant-based diet influences gut microbiota.
results_summary: A plant-based diet positively affects gut microbiota, even when deficient in n-3 PUFAs, and increases beneficial intestinal bacteria compared to a Western diet. The gut microbiota composition may help personalize n-3 PUFA supplementation effects on brain health.
population_specificity: Human and animal studies (no specific population detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of a low-fat plant-based diet on migraine severity and frequency in adult migraine sufferers.
results_summary: The study found that a low-fat vegan diet led to a greater reduction in worst headache pain and average headache intensity compared to a placebo supplement, though frequency reduction was similar between groups. Participants reported greater overall improvement in pain during the diet period.
population_specificity: 42 adult migraine sufferers recruited from the general community in Washington, DC.
effective_dosage: Not specified (dietary intervention, no supplement dosage mentioned).
study_duration: 16 weeks per treatment period (with a 4-week washout).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare nutritional intakes between vegan and omnivorous bodybuilders during bulking and cutting phases to assess the adequacy of a plant-based diet for muscle growth and maintenance.
results_summary: Both vegans and omnivores had similar energy, carbohydrate, and fat intakes, but vegans reduced protein intake during cutting. Vegan bodybuilders may struggle to meet protein needs during caloric deficits, suggesting a need for professional nutritional planning.
population_specificity: 18 male and female natural bodybuilders (8 vegans, 10 omnivores).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of plant-based meats on biomarkers of inflammation compared to animal meats in generally healthy adults.
results_summary: The study found that only 4 out of 92 biomarkers showed statistically significant differences between plant-based and animal meat consumption, contrary to the hypothesis that plant-based meats would improve inflammation markers.
population_specificity: Generally healthy adults

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compile traditional and modern evidence on medicinal plants, including Plantago Major Seeds, for potential use in treating inflammatory bowel disease (IBD).
results_summary: The study noted that there is no or insufficient research to confirm the benefits of Plantago Major Seeds in IBD, placing it among herbs requiring further evaluation.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of traditional and modern sources).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of a green plantain-based diet versus a yogurt-based diet on stool volume, frequency, and weight gain in children with persistent diarrhea.
results_summary: The green plantain-based diet significantly reduced stool output and consistency, shortened diarrhea duration, and increased daily weight gain compared to the yogurt-based diet, while also being more cost-effective.
population_specificity: 80 children (1-28 months old) with persistent diarrhea lasting ≥14 days.
effective_dosage: 50 g/L of cooked green plantain-based diet.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of Asian plantain (Plantago asiatica) essential oil (PAEO) on lipid metabolism, including its potential hypocholesterolaemic and cardiovascular protective benefits.
results_summary: PAEO altered the expression of LDL receptor and HMG-CoA reductase, reduced plasma total cholesterol and TAG concentrations, and inhibited LDL oxidation. These effects suggest potential cardiovascular benefits through improved lipid metabolism.
population_specificity: HepG2 cells and C57BL/6 mice.
effective_dosage: 0-200 µg/ml in vitro; 0.2 mg/ml in vitro; oral administration in mice (exact dosage not specified).
study_duration: 24 hours in vitro; 3 weeks in mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify and characterize lectins in bananas and plantains, specifically BanLec and PlanLec, and explore their biological properties and implications.
results_summary: The study identified BanLec and PlanLec as dimeric lectins with specificity for mannose, demonstrated their mitogenic activity in murine T-cells, and noted their induction in leaves after methyl jasmonate treatment. The findings suggest these lectins are more widespread in monocots than previously believed.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro and murine models)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of different frying conditions (temperature and time) on the retention of micronutrients (ascorbic acid, potassium, and carotenoids) in plantain.
results_summary: Deep-fat frying preserved carotenoid content across all conditions and potassium content except at 120°C/24 min (≤11% loss). Ascorbic acid showed significant but incomplete loss (≤45%), with the greatest degradation occurring at low temperature and long frying time (120°C/24 min). High-temperature, short-duration frying better preserved nutritional quality.
population_specificity: Plantain (Musa AAB 'barraganete') samples.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (thermal treatment conditions: 120-180°C for 4-24 min).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of a plantain flour-based oral rehydration solution (ORS/plantain) compared to the standard ORS/WHO solution in treating dehydration and diarrhea in children.
results_summary: The plantain flour-based solution was as effective as the standard ORS/WHO in correcting dehydration, with no significant differences in rehydration success, time, or stool output. However, no antidiarrheal properties were demonstrated for the ORS/plantain solution.
population_specificity: 101 children aged 1 to 48 months with mild dehydration and diarrhea lasting less than one week.
effective_dosage: 50 g of precooked plantain flour in the ORS/plantain solution.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic potential of Plantain (Plantago lanceolata L.) for upper respiratory infections, focusing on its anti-inflammatory, spasmolytic, and immunostimulatory effects.
results_summary: The study found that Plantain exhibits anti-inflammatory, spasmolytic, and immunostimulatory properties, supporting its use for moderate chronic irritative cough, particularly in children. However, clinical data are limited, and efficacy is primarily supported by experimental research.
population_specificity: General population, with specific mention of children for chronic irritative cough.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of Musa paradisiaca stem kernel juice on reducing kidney stone formation and related enzyme activities in urolithiatic rats.
results_summary: The extract significantly reduced the activities of oxalate-synthesizing enzymes and lowered crystalline components in kidney and urine. It also decreased urinary enzyme activities associated with stone formation, except for leucine amino peptidase, which showed no change.
population_specificity: Experimental urolithiatic rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of a plantain flour-based solution compared to WHO-ORS for rehydration in children with acute diarrheal diseases.
results_summary: The plantain flour-based solution showed comparable rehydration success rates (88.0% vs. 85.9%) and faster rehydration times (4.88 h vs. 5.28 h) compared to WHO-ORS, with significantly lower stool output (4.69 g/kg/h vs. 8.45 g/kg/h). However, some children in the plantain group experienced decreases in blood sodium and potassium levels.
population_specificity: Children with acute diarrheal diseases.
effective_dosage: 50 g/l of plantain flour and 3.5 g/l of sodium chloride (NaCl).
study_duration: Rehydration was completed in approximately 4.88 to 5.28 hours.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of predators and plant genotype on caterpillar behavior, herbivory patterns, growth, and survivorship using two genotypes of Plantago lanceolata (plantain).
results_summary: Stinkbugs reduced specialist caterpillar survivorship but not generalists, influenced both species' behavior, and decreased herbivory on initial plants. Plant genotype affected plant size and herbivory but not caterpillar location or growth rate.
population_specificity: Caterpillars (Junonia coenia and Pyrrharctia isabella) and stinkbugs (Podisus maculiventris) in an experimental garden setting.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if plantain sap could reduce the acute toxic effects of 5-fluorouracil (5-FU) on gut mucosa in mice with Ehrlich ascites tumors.
results_summary: Plantain sap was shown to mitigate the toxic effects of 5-FU on gut mucosa and normalize certain epithelial cell parameters. Combined treatment with 5-FU and plantain sap led to a more drastic decline in tumor cell DNA levels compared to 5-FU alone.
population_specificity: Mice with Ehrlich ascites tumors.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of Aloe vera/Plantago major gel (Plantavera gel) in healing diabetic foot ulcers (DFU).
results_summary: Plantavera gel significantly reduced ulcer surface area compared to the control group, though no significant difference was observed in ulcer depth. No side effects were reported during the study.
population_specificity: Forty patients with diabetic foot ulcers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the anti-ulcerogenic effects of dried unripe plantain banana preparations in rats, comparing prophylactic and healing effects against aspirin-induced ulcers.
results_summary: Dried unripe plantain banana preparations showed significant anti-ulcerogenic effects both as a preventive measure and in healing existing ulcers, while ripe bananas were ineffective. The active components were water-soluble and concentrated, stimulating gastric mucosa growth, unlike other tested substances.
population_specificity: Rats with aspirin-induced ulcers.
effective_dosage: Not specified (extract concentrated ~300x compared to dried banana powder).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the reaction frequency and profiles of standardized aeroallergen patch test preparations, including Plantain, in patients with suspected aeroallergen-dependent eczematous skin lesions.
results_summary: Plantain was among the less common aeroallergens causing positive patch test reactions (1.6%). Positive reactions to aeroallergens were more frequent in patients with atopic dermatitis (AD).
population_specificity: Patients with suspected aeroallergen-dependent eczematous skin lesions, including those with and without atopic dermatitis (AD), tested in 15 dermatology clinics between 2000 and 2015.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of Policosanol (PCO) and red yeast rice (RYR) on dyslipidemia, antioxidant status, and organ functionality in hyperlipidemic zebrafish.
results_summary: Policosanol significantly reduced total cholesterol, triglycerides, and LDL-C while increasing HDL-C. It also improved antioxidant status, blood glucose levels, and provided hepatoprotection, kidney protection, and reduced oxidative stress in the brain, ovary, and testis.
population_specificity: Hyperlipidemic zebrafish

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the consumption of medicinal plants, including Plantain, among outpatients on long-term warfarin therapy to assess potential herb-drug interactions.
results_summary: Plantain was one of the most commonly consumed medicinal plants, primarily used for digestive, urinary, and respiratory tract issues, with tea being the predominant form of consumption. The study noted potential herb-warfarin interactions for some plants, but specific details about Plantain's effects were not provided.
population_specificity: Outpatients with cardiopathy diagnosis on long-term warfarin therapy in a Brazilian public hospital (average age 56.8 ± 13.1 years, 54.6% female).
interactions: Potential herb-warfarin interactions mentioned, but Plantain-specific details not provided.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a nutraceutical formulation containing policosanol, among other ingredients, in reducing LDL-C levels in low cardiovascular risk patients with dyslipidemia.
results_summary: The study found a statistically significant reduction in Total Cholesterol (13.1%) and LDL-C (20.4%) after 12 weeks of treatment. The formulation was safe and well-tolerated, with stable hepatic and muscular function.
population_specificity: Patients with dyslipidemia at low cardiovascular risk, unresponsive to diet and physical activity (mean age 48.02 ± 10.1 years; 60% male).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of combining high-intensity exercise with Cuban policosanol (Raydel®, 20 mg) consumption on metabolic disorders in obese subjects.
results_summary: The study found significant improvements in BMI, waist circumference, fat mass, blood pressure, lipid profile, HDL functionality, and antioxidant abilities, along with increased CoQ10 levels and reduced hepatic function parameters, without liver damage.
population_specificity: 17 obese subjects (average BMI 30.1 ± 1.1 kg/m², 8 male and 9 female).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of policosanol, alone and in combination with genistein and vitamin D, on inhibiting vascular smooth muscle cell calcification induced by inorganic phosphate.
results_summary: Policosanol reduced osteogenic differentiation of vascular smooth muscle cells in a dose-dependent manner. Combined with genistein and vitamin D, it showed greater inhibition of calcification and RUNX2 expression compared to single treatments.
population_specificity: Primary human vascular smooth muscle cells (VSMCs) in vitro.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of three different policosanols on dyslipidemia and organ protection (liver, kidney, ovary, testis) in hypercholesterolemic zebrafish.
results_summary: Cuban (Raydel®) policosanol (PCO1) showed the highest survivability, improved lipid profiles, reduced inflammation and oxidative stress, and enhanced reproductive outcomes compared to Chinese (Shaanxi) and US (Lesstanol®) policosanols. PCO1 also demonstrated superior liver, kidney, ovarian, and testicular protection with minimal adverse effects.
population_specificity: Hypercholesterolemic zebrafish

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of policosanol supplementation on the levels of alanine transaminase (ALT) and aspartate transaminase (AST) in adults.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found significant reductions in ALT and AST serum levels after policosanol intervention, with the most pronounced effects observed at a dose of 20 mg/d. The dose-response analysis indicated a non-linear relationship between dosage, duration, and enzyme reduction.
population_specificity: Adults (2535 participants across 23 trials)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of policosanol on osteogenic differentiation in MC3T3-E1 cells and zebrafish models, focusing on its molecular mechanism.
results_summary: Policosanol increased osteogenic gene expression (Dlx5, Runx2), alkaline phosphatase activity, and extracellular mineralization in MC3T3-E1 cells. It also promoted fin regeneration in zebrafish via AMPK-mediated INSIGs expression.
population_specificity: MC3T3-E1 cells and zebrafish models.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if policosanol (PCO) could protect against cognitive decline, synaptic plasticity impairment, oxidative stress, and Aβ plaque formation in an Alzheimer's disease (AD) rat model.
results_summary: PCO treatment improved spatial learning and memory, enhanced hippocampal synaptic plasticity, reduced oxidative stress markers, and inhibited Aβ plaque formation in Aβ-infused rats.
population_specificity: Adult male Wistar rats with induced AD-like pathology.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential therapeutic effects of policosanol derived from insect wax (PIW) on Parkinson's disease symptoms in Caenorhabditis elegans models.
results_summary: PIW treatment reduced α-synuclein aggregation, suppressed loss of dopaminergic neurons, decreased ROS and MDA levels, restored lipid abundance, and prolonged lifespan in the models, possibly by regulating stress response pathways.
population_specificity: Caenorhabditis elegans models of Parkinson's disease (NL5901, N2, and BZ555).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether policosanol (PCO) could improve cognitive function, oxidative-antioxidative status, and reduce amyloid-beta plaque formation in an Alzheimer's disease rat model.
results_summary: PCO treatment improved cognitive decline, oxidative-antioxidative status, and reduced Aβ plaque formation in Aβ-induced AD rats. The results suggest PCO may mitigate AD-related neuropathological changes.
population_specificity: Adult male Wistar rats with Aβ-induced Alzheimer's disease model.
effective_dosage: 50 mg/kg, administered via gavage for 8 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anti-dyslipidaemic efficacy of Recapsoma®, a mixture containing Policosanol, by studying its effects on cholesterol synthesis, triglycerides, and LDL-cholesterol oxidation in vitro.
results_summary: The study found that the Recapsoma® mixture, including Policosanol, inhibited key enzymes (PCSK, ACAT, PAP, HMGR) and increased LDL receptor activity, suggesting synergistic effects for controlling hypercholesterolemia. The results indicate potential as an alternative to statins, particularly for metabolic syndrome patients.
population_specificity: In vitro study (no specific human population mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Cuban policosanol (PCO) could improve memory and reduce Alzheimer's disease (AD) pathology in a mouse model of AD.
results_summary: PCO treatment reduced amyloid plaques, gliosis, inflammatory cytokines, and oxidative stress markers in the brains of 5xFAD mice, while also improving memory deficits and synaptic loss.
population_specificity: 5xFAD mice (an animal model of Alzheimer's disease)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the potential antifibrotic effect of policosanol compared to silymarin and explore the underlying molecular mechanisms in a rat model of liver fibrosis.
results_summary: Policosanol restored normal levels of liver enzymes, oxidative stress markers, angiogenic growth factors, and pro-inflammatory cytokines in fibrotic rats, showing comparable efficacy to silymarin. The study suggests policosanol could be a promising natural therapeutic for liver fibrosis.
population_specificity: Rats with induced liver fibrosis

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of policosanol on vascular calcification and its molecular mechanism in vascular smooth muscle cells.
results_summary: Policosanol reduced the expression of osteogenic genes (Dlx5 and Runx2) induced by inorganic phosphate (Pi) and increased AMPK phosphorylation. AMPK activation further suppressed Pi-induced vascular calcification by regulating INSIG expression.
population_specificity: Vascular smooth muscle cells (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the mechanism by which policosanol prevents androgenetic alopecia (AGA) by regulating hormone levels and suppressing premature hair follicle regression.
results_summary: Policosanol reduced serum testosterone and T/E2 ratio, improved VEGF and EGF expression, enhanced ALP activity, and inhibited apoptosis in DHT-treated dermal papilla cells. The optimal effect was observed at 12.50 g/mL.
population_specificity: Kunming mice with testosterone-induced androgenetic alopecia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of policosanol derived from insect wax (PIW) on Aβ-induced toxicity and lifespan in a transgenic C. elegans model of Alzheimer's disease.
results_summary: PIW reduced Aβ-induced paralysis by ~20% and extended lifespan by ~26% in C. elegans. It also downregulated the amyloid precursor-like protein (apl-1) and modulated genes related to longevity pathways.
population_specificity: Transgenic Caenorhabditis elegans (CL4176 strain) modeling Alzheimer's disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to verify the safety of policosanol supplementation for domestic cats and compare its effects (raw and encapsulated forms) with positive (L-carnitine) and negative (no supplementation) controls on various health parameters.
results_summary: Policosanol showed no significant effects on lipid profile, serum biochemistry, activity, energy expenditure, or respiratory quotient, but cats fed raw policosanol took longer to consume a second meal. The study concluded policosanol is safe for feline consumption.
population_specificity: Healthy young adult cats (mean age 3.0 ± 1.0 years; mean weight 4.36 ± 1.08 kg).
effective_dosage: Raw policosanol (10 mg/kg body weight), encapsulated policosanol (50 mg/kg body weight).
study_duration: 28 days per treatment period with a 1-week washout between periods.

study_goal: To determine the multiple functions of policosanol in elderly dyslipidemia patients, including its effects on platelet aggregation, endothelial function, and atherosclerosis progression.
results_summary: Policosanol (20 mg) significantly decreased ADP-induced platelet aggregation but not AA-induced aggregation. It also reduced CEC counts, hs-CRP, and homocysteine levels, suggesting improved endothelial function and potential delay in atherosclerosis progression.
population_specificity: Elderly dyslipidemia patients (n=294)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of octacosanol and policosanol on high-fat diet-induced obesity and metabolic disorders in mice.
results_summary: Octacosanol and policosanol reduced body weight gain, body fat gain, insulin resistance, and hepatic lipid content in mice fed a high-fat diet. These effects were associated with increased BAT activity, improved hepatic lipid metabolism, and reduced WAT inflammation.
population_specificity: Mice fed a high-fat diet.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the effects of policosanol + aspirin versus placebo + aspirin on functional recovery in hypertensive patients with recent non-cardioembolic ischemic stroke.
results_summary: Policosanol + aspirin significantly reduced mRS scores from the first interim check-up, with 80.3% achieving mRS ≤1 compared to 8.5% in the placebo group. The treatment effect improved over six months, with minimal adverse events reported.
population_specificity: Hypertensive patients with recent non-cardioembolic ischemic stroke (mRS score 2-4).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the long-term effects of policosanol supplementation on blood pressure and lipid profile in healthy Korean participants with pre-hypertension.
results_summary: Policosanol supplementation (20 mg) significantly reduced systolic and diastolic blood pressure, aortic blood pressure, and blood renin and aldosterone levels while improving lipid profiles by lowering total cholesterol and increasing HDL-C. The effects were dose-dependent.
population_specificity: Healthy Korean participants with pre-hypertension (systolic 120-139 mmHg, diastolic 85-89 mmHg).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically investigate the efficacy and safety of sugarcane policosanol for treating dyslipidemia.
results_summary: Policosanol significantly reduced total cholesterol and LDL-c while increasing HDL-c, but had no significant effect on triglycerides or body weight. Cuban studies showed better results, and policosanol was found to be safer than control agents.
population_specificity: 1886 subjects with dyslipidemia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether policosanol, when added to aspirin therapy within 30 days of stroke onset, improves long-term recovery in patients with non-cardioembolic ischemic stroke compared to placebo + aspirin.
results_summary: Policosanol + aspirin significantly reduced mean modified Rankin Scale scores from 1.5 months onward, with 87.5% of patients achieving mRS ≤1 compared to 0% in the placebo group. It also improved Barthel Index scores and positively affected LDL and HDL cholesterol levels.
population_specificity: 80 patients (mean age 69) with non-cardioembolic ischemic stroke within 30 days of onset and moderate severity (mRS 2-4).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the antiplatelet mechanisms of rice bran policosanol extract (RBE) in hyperlipidemic rats, comparing its effects to aspirin.
results_summary: Low-dose RBE (100 mg/kg) inhibited platelet aggregation comparably to aspirin (30 mg/kg) without affecting platelet count, bleeding time, or coagulation time. RBE reduced thromboxane A2 levels and increased prostacyclin, suggesting a different antiplatelet mechanism than aspirin.
population_specificity: Hyperlipidemic Sprague Dawley rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the hair growth-promoting effects of white wax (WW) and policosanol of white wax (WWP) on androgenetic alopecia in mice and their potential mechanisms of action.
results_summary: WW and WWP significantly reduced hair loss and promoted hair growth in mice, outperforming finasteride. They increased proliferation of human follicle dermal papilla cells (HFDPCs) and inhibited 5α-reductase activity, reducing testosterone conversion to dihydrotestosterone.
population_specificity: Mice with testosterone-induced alopecia and cultured human follicle dermal papilla cells (HFDPCs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the lipid correction capacity and safety of policosanol combined with rosuvastatin versus rosuvastatin monotherapy in patients with stable coronary artery disease and moderate hepatic dysfunction.
results_summary: Concomitant use of policosanol and rosuvastatin was superior to rosuvastatin alone in improving lipid profiles (reducing TC, LDL-C, and TG while increasing HDL-C), decreasing oxidative stress (MDA), and enhancing hepatic function, with no therapy discontinuations due to adverse events.
population_specificity: Patients aged 37-72 with stable coronary artery disease, moderate hepatic dysfunction, and inadequate LDL-C control despite statin therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the antiplatelet aggregation mechanisms of crude rice bran policosanol extract, focusing on its effects on platelet adhesion, aggregation, and secretion.
results_summary: The study found that rice bran policosanol extract significantly inhibited platelet aggregation and adhesion in a dose-dependent manner, with varying IC50 values for different agonists, and reduced cellular protein secretion from activated platelets.
population_specificity: Rat platelets (in vitro study)
effective_dosage: Concentrations ranging from 15.625 μg/mL to 693.86 μg/mL

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of policosanol supplementation on blood cholesterol and glucose levels, as well as its impact on hepatic cholesterol biosynthesis via HMG-CoA reductase activity in Wistar rats.
results_summary: Policosanol significantly reduced blood cholesterol, glucose, triglycerides, and LDL-cholesterol levels, as well as HMG-CoA reductase activity in the liver, indicating suppression of cholesterol biosynthesis.
population_specificity: Wistar rats fed high-cholesterol diets

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of policosanol on aortic calcification, atherosclerosis progression, and related biomarkers in diabetic hyperlipemic rats, comparing it to atorvastatin and omega-3 fatty acids.
results_summary: Policosanol significantly reduced foam cell density, improved aortic intimal lesions, increased HDL-C and Vitamin D, and inhibited calcification, inflammation, and oxidative stress, outperforming atorvastatin in some aspects.
population_specificity: Adult male Wistar rats with induced diabetic hyperlipidemia.
effective_dosage: 10 mg/kg body weight, daily oral dose.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the safety and efficacy of policosanol versus high-dose clopidogrel in reducing platelet reactivity in patients with high on-treatment platelet reactivity after drug-eluting stent implantation.
results_summary: Policosanol reduced platelet reactivity similarly to high-dose clopidogrel but with significantly lower bleeding rates. The benefits of policosanol on bleeding persisted at the 2-year follow-up.
population_specificity: Patients with high on-treatment platelet reactivity after drug-eluting stent implantation.
study_duration: 6 months for policosanol, 1 year for clopidogrel.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the mechanism of action of policosanol (PCO) on HDL functionality and its anti-senescence effects, including antioxidant, anti-glycation, and tissue regenerative activities.
results_summary: PCO encapsulated in rHDL (PCO-rHDL) demonstrated potent antioxidant activity, inhibited LDL oxidation and glycation, reduced CETP activity by up to 47%, and enhanced tissue regeneration by 2.4- to 3.6-fold compared to controls. It also showed cytoprotective effects in monocytes and macrophages with reduced ROS production and apoptosis.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro and animal model study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the optimal conditions for dispersing Policosanol in an aqueous solution using amylomaize starch dextrin and to evaluate its stability.
results_summary: The study found that Policosanol formed a crystalline V-amylose complex with dextrin, with 95% dispersibility under optimal conditions (30 min interval, 1.0% dextrin solution, 12h complex formation time). Around 70% of the Policosanol remained stable against sonication, indicating dextrin acted as both a stabilizer and complex-forming agent.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)
effective_dosage: 50-100mg Policosanol in 50 mL aqueous solution (0.5-2.0% solids, w/v)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the therapeutic effects of policosanol and atorvastatin in a gerbil model of global cerebral ischemia, focusing on symptoms, neuronal damage, and oxidative markers.
results_summary: Policosanol (100 and 200 mg/kg) significantly reduced ischemia-reperfusion-induced symptoms, neuronal damage, and plasma oxidative markers compared to controls. It was more effective than atorvastatin in reducing hyperlocomotion and oxidative stress.
population_specificity: Gerbils with induced global cerebral ischemia.
study_duration: Treatments were administered 4 hours after ischemia induction (duration not further specified).
